Source code for base_propagator

#!/usr/bin/env python

'''A parent class used for interfacing any propagator.

'''

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 
from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D
import plothelp


[docs]class base_propagator:
    def __init__(self,name=''):
        self.name = name #this is the first level above base propagator
        self.parent_object = {'object': False} #this is the levels above the second level
        
    # get orbital elements in ECEF format at time t

[docs]    def get_orbit(self,t,a,e,inc,raan,aop,mu0,mjd0,A=1,m=1e3,C_D=2.3):
        return(None)



# unix 2 julian

[docs]def unix2jd(us):
    return ( us/86400.0 + 2440587.5)

#  julian 2 unix

[docs]def jd2unix(mjd0):
    return ( (mjd0-2440587.5)*86400.0 )

    


[docs]def plot_orbit_3d(ecefs):
    fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,15))
    ax = fig.add_subplot(111, projection='3d')
    ax.view_init(15, 5)
    plothelp.draw_earth(ax)
    plothelp.draw_radar(ax,69,19)    
    ax.plot(ecefs[0,:],ecefs[1,:],ecefs[2,:],".",alpha=0.5,color="black")
    plt.title("Orbital propagation")
    plt.show()
